sources.title: Complete Rochester 2GC Carburetor Guide
sources.snippet: The Rochester 2GC is a two-barrel carburetor used extensively in GM vehicles from 1955-1979.

sources.title: Carburetor Rebuild Fundamentals
sources.snippet: Essential steps for rebuilding any carburetor include cleaning, inspection, and gasket replacement.

sources.title: Rochester 2GC Technical Specifications
sources.snippet: Factory specifications for jet sizes, float levels, and timing settings.

summary: The Rochester 2GC is a reliable two-barrel carburetor that can be rebuilt with basic tools. Key components include the float, needle valve, jets, accelerator pump, and choke mechanism.
